definition: to dispatch an army/to send troops
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: The officers were still reluctant to unleash their troops in pursuit of a defeated enemy.
sentences.chinese: 军官们仍不愿发兵乘胜追击溃败的敌人。

sentences.english: Cats have made soldiers went to the mouse States, saw the red mouse.
sentences.chinese: 猫们发兵去了鼠国，看到了小红鼠。

sentences.english: But when the king heard thereof, he was wroth: and he sent forth his armies, and destroyed those murderers, and burned up their city.
sentences.chinese: 王就大怒，发兵除灭那些凶手，烧毁他们的城。

definition: to go on a punitive expedition
to put down a revolt/to pacify a rebellion
to take to the field oneself (of emperor)/to take part in person in an expedition
to circulate (a protest or call to arms)/to promulgate
to serve the king diligently/to save the country in times of danger/to send troops to rescue the king
to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
the emperor leads his troops into battle (idiom)/to take part personally in an expedition
